Activity: Wake up, have coffee and review industry news related to high-frequency trading infrastructure and data feed technologies. Specifically focusing on latency and reliability improvements.
Log in, check emails, and review meeting requests. Respond to urgent queries from @SDEV-1 and @SDEV-2 regarding existing code repositories and coding standards.
Begin drafting a high-level architecture document for the data feeds and trading platform. Focus on outlining the major components, data flow, and system interactions.

Email @QRES-1, @QRES-2, and @QRES-3 to schedule a meeting to discuss their data requirements and preferred data formats for the trading platform. @PEOPLE: @QRES-1, @QRES-2, @QRES-3 Subject: Data Requirements for Trading Platform.
Research vendor solutions for low-latency market data feeds (e.g., Bloomberg, Refinitiv, FactSet). Create a comparison matrix based on cost, latency, historical data availability, and API support.
Lunch Break - Review technical blogs and articles on system design patterns for high-performance trading systems.

Meeting with @QRES-1, @QRES-2, and @QRES-3 to gather detailed requirements. Take detailed notes focusing on data frequency, data cleansing requirements, and the specific data points needed for their models.
Refine the architecture document based on the meeting feedback. Begin outlining the data processing pipeline, including data ingestion, validation, transformation, and storage.
Research message queue technologies suitable for handling high volumes of market data (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ). Evaluate their performance characteristics, scalability, and fault tolerance.
End of Day - Review the day's progress and plan for tomorrow. Write a summary of the vendor research.
